title: Introduction to Cognitive Science
desc: Become familiar with and invested in cognitive science research, focusing on big themes in the study of the mind and mental representation, exemplified by interdisciplinary work conducted at Northwestern University. Social Behavioral Sciences Distro Area Social and Behavioral Science Foundational Discipl

title: Evaluating Evidence
desc: Introduction to evaluation of qualitative and quantitative evidence across science, politics, society, health, education, and industry. POLI_SCI 212-0 and COG_SCI 202-0 are taught together; may not receive credit for both courses. Empirical and Deductive Reasoning Foundational Dis Formal Studies Distro Area Social Behavioral Sciences Distro Area

title: Introduction to Cognitive Modeling
desc: Introduction to artificial intelligence and cognitive science. Fundamental questions concerning thinking, language understanding, analogy, commonsense reasoning, education, emotions and consciousness. Formal Studies Distro Area Social Behavioral Sciences Distro Area Social and Behavioral Science Foundational Discipl

title: Language and the Brain
desc: The study of language and its biological basis from linguistic, psychological, and neuroscientific perspectives. Natural Sciences Distro Area Natural Sciences Foundational Discipline

title: Learning, Representation & Reasoning
desc: Interdisciplinary study of the nature of the mind with emphasis on learning, representation, and reasoning. Social Behavioral Sciences Distro Area Social and Behavioral Science Foundational Discipl

title: Selected Topics in Cognitive Science
desc: Topics in cognitive science. Content varies. May be repeated for credit with change of topic.

title: Presenting Ideas & Data
desc: Understanding principles of cognitive psychology, data visualization, and graphic design to present ideas and data in an engaging, clear, and memorable manner. PSYCH 345-0 and COG_SCI 345-0 are taught together; may not receive credit for both courses. title: Cognitive Science Proseminar
desc: Seminar focused on current trends in cognitive science research and discussions with Northwestern cognitive science faculty. For cognitive science majors/minors or with consent of instructor.

title: Senior Thesis Seminar
desc: Independent research for a senior thesis under the direction of department faculty. By invitation only.

title: Independent Study
